infinitive absolute for emphasis; ESV 'I will surely multiply', NASB 'I will greatly multiply', KJV 'I will greatly multiply'
1st singular imperfect; Hebrew idiom with infinitive absolute for emphasis; ESV, NASB, KJV
noun construct with 2nd feminine singular possessive suffix; 'itsbon' means sorrowful toil or labor pain; ESV 'your pain', NASB 'your pain', KJV 'thy sorrow'

words.phrase: and your conception / and your pregnancy
words.source: conjunction + noun with 2nd feminine singular possessive suffix; 'heron' means conception or pregnancy; ESV 'in childbearing', NASB 'in childbirth', KJV 'in sorrow thou shalt bring forth'
preposition + noun; 'etsev' means pain, effort, or work; ESV 'in pain', NASB 'in pain', KJV 'in sorrow'

words.phrase: you will bring forth / you shall bear
words.source: 2nd feminine singular imperfect; ESV 'you shall bring forth', NASB 'you will bring forth', KJV 'thou shalt bring forth'
masculine plural noun; ESV, NASB, KJV
noun construct with 2nd feminine singular possessive suffix; ESV, NASB, KJV

noun construct with 2nd feminine singular possessive suffix; 'teshuqah' appears only 3 times in Hebrew Bible (Gen 3:16, Gen 4:7, Song 7:10); ESV 'your desire shall be for', NASB 'your desire will be for', KJV 'thy desire shall be to'
conjunction + 3rd masculine singular pronoun; ESV, NASB, KJV

words.phrase: he will rule / he shall rule
words.source: 3rd masculine singular imperfect of 'mashal' (to rule); same verb used for Philistine ruling in Judges 14:4; yiqtol form suggests modal sense 'he will seek to rule'; ESV 'he shall rule', NASB 'he will rule', KJV 'he shall rule'
preposition + 2nd feminine singular pronoun; ESV, NASB, KJV
